items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 11 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41467-026-68310-w Mechanically reconfigurable mechanisms offer a cost-effective, low-complexity approach to build high-capacity multiplexing wavefront modulation devices, yet current studies achieve insufficient channel numbers for practical applications due to limited mechanical transformations and suboptimal optimization models. Here, authors propose a diffractive magic cube network to address this challenge.

items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 11 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-68257-4 In the adrenal cortex, cholesterol used for steroid production is stored in lipid droplets. The authors demonstrate here the importance of the transcription factor HHEX in maintaining glucocorticoid levels and protecting lipid droplets from androgen-induced lipid depletion.

items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 10 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67989-7 Researchers developed a simple, industry-compatible method using an indium buffer layer between cobalt and 2D materials to form vdWs tunnel contacts. This achieved high spin injection efficiency in both graphene and MoS2, enabling future large-scale spintronic devices.

items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 10 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-68225-y Here the authors utilize magnetic attraction and elastic tension to create instabilities that amplify vibrations and induce inertia-driven hysteresis. The design enables efficient mechanical memory with both volatile and non-volatile modes.

items.title: The urgent need for African research collaboration on medicine quality
authors: Fanqi Zeng

Gerry Mshana
Daniel Amoako-Sakyi

items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 10 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67430-z Substandard and falsified medicines are a global health threat. The fight against them is a regulatory and research challenge; here, the authors argue the importance of global and regional oversight, monitoring of, and research into the extent of the issue.
